revised_title: Dichromats' Advantage in Detecting Color-Camouflaged Objects
tldr: Dichromats, who have reduced color vision, can detect color-camouflaged objects better than trichromats, who have normal color vision. This is because color variation can interfere with texture segregation for trichromats, but dichromats are not affected by this interference. This discovery could help explain why dichromacy is still prevalent in the human population.
